node.title: Business Education Partnership
node.subtitle: An online platform to connect high school students to oppurtunities
node.description: As part of my work at UW Blueprint, I'm working on a team to develop a matching platform to help high school students meet local employers and industry professionals for job and volunteer oppurtunities, in the hopes to increase accessibility for students.

node.title: Social Development Center
node.subtitle: Digital Flowcharts to provide access to social-services information
node.description: As part of my work at UW Blueprint, I helped develop an online platform to allow users to retrieve information regarding legal, housing and financial help in their community.

node.title: Bittorent Client
node.subtitle: A CLI Bittorent Client, built in Go
node.description: To learn more about networking, concurrency, encoding and Go, I built a bittorent client.

node.title: Assemble
node.subtitle: Generate Math Contests, powered by Elasticsearch
node.description: In an effort to explore GraphQL and web scraping, I built an API that triaged and indexed over 20 years of AMC Math Contest Questions and generated practice contests for students based on filters. Built using JavaScript and GraphQL, with a backend powered by Elasticsearch.

node.title: Insuremotion
node.subtitle: Hack the 6ix 2019
node.description: A mobile app that tracks your driving to determine whether or not you have a road rage problem. Built using OpenCV, React Native (Expo) and Flask. I was responsible for the OpenCV backend.

node.title: MoleculAR
node.subtitle: The visual search engine for molecules in AR. Presented at Hack the North 2019
node.description: MoleculAR is an AR application that takes in the common names of almost all possible chemicals, computationally generates a 3D structure of that molecule and proceeds to render that in an AR space. I worked on the AR Frontend using ViroReact and acted in a PM Role.

node.title: BlindChess
node.subtitle: Chess for the blind, or for anyone looking to improve their memory. Presented at PCHacks 2019.
node.description: Uses a Google Home, Dialougeflow and Stockfish to allow a user to connect to play a game of chess by talking. Written in Python (Flask).
